001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
009
010/**
011 * A {@link Regime} implementation that performs full-batch training.
012 *
013 * <p>If constructed with a delegate regime, training is forwarded to the
014 * delegate. If no delegate is provided (i.e. constructed with {@link #BatchRegime()}),
015 * this regime defaults to <em>batch mode</em>: the optimizer is invoked once
016 * per training call using the entire {@link DataSet} as a single batch.</p>
017 *
018 * <h3>Behavior</h3>
019 * <ul>
020 *   <li><strong>With delegate:</strong> All calls to {@link #train} are
021 *   forwarded to the delegate.</li>
022 *   <li><strong>Without delegate:</strong> The loss gradient is computed over
023 *   the full dataset and the optimizer is applied once.</li>
024 * </ul>
025 *
026 * @see DelegatedRegime
027 */
028@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
029public final class BatchRegime extends DelegatedRegime {
030
031    /**
032     * Creates a batch regime with no delegate.
033     * <p>In this mode the optimizer is invoked once using the full dataset
034     * as a single batch.</p>
035     */
036    public BatchRegime() {
037        this(null);
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * Creates a batch regime that delegates training to the given regime.
042     *
043     * @param regime the regime to delegate to, or {@code null} for standalone batch mode
044     */
045    public BatchRegime(Regime regime) {
046        super(regime);
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Trains the estimation function either by delegating to the wrapped
051     * regime (if non-null) or, in standalone mode, by invoking the optimizer
052     * once using the entire dataset as a single batch.
053     *
054     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
055     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
056     * @param objective          the objective (loss) function
057     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to apply parameter updates
058     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
059     */
060    @Override
061    public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer) {
062        regime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
063    }
064}
